**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:


/kind bug
/sig validation

**What happened**:

Kubernetes forbids updating on existing pod's labels on the fly. But in my case, I want to update a pod's label so that add/remove it from service/endpoints. Is it possible to only suppress the validation of pods' label field via configuration without modifying [k8s validation src code](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/83e46f0a9ede14431e1ae0950e8bd8fc6a1c43e2/pkg/apis/core/validation/validation.go#L3246)?

> Forbidden: pod updates may not change fields other than spec.containers[ *].image, spec.initContainers[*].image, spec.activeDeadlineSeconds or spec.tolerations (only additions to existing tolerations)

Integration of [spinnaker](https://github.com/spinnaker/spinnaker) with k8s is working by rolling updating pod's label in order to update the endpoint, so banning this modification entirely breaks its working mechanism.

**What you expected to happen**:
Allow modification of existing pod labels on the fly via configuration
